result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb Anthony Hosey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Caleb Anthony Hosey in court, in custody.  
Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Caleb Anthony Hosey.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Final Pretrial.
Case remains in trial posture. Court reviewed and addressed with the parties final pretrial documents. 
Court ordered case adjourned for an additional final pretrial.  
Jury Trial remains calendared for November 14, 2022 at 9:0o0oam.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed: DEFENDANT'S Proposed Jury Instructions.
Received and filed: Defendant's Witness List.
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to Exclude DNA Evidence.
Received and filed: STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE.
Received and filed: STATE'S Requested Jury Instructions.
Received and filed: State's Witness List.
Received and Filed: State's Notice of Expert Testimony,

Defendant Caleb Anthony Hosey not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Caleb Anthony Hosey. Attorney William Ackell appeared in person for  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Scheduling conference.  
Court waived appearance. Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Court ordered state to file joinder motion 2 weeks in advance for final pretrial.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Caleb Anthony Sadowski in court, appear by video with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs, appear in person.  Defendant Caleb Anthony Sadowski in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to case 20CF1070 & 20CF4547. Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer R. Seghers.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Caleb Anthony Hosey not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Opland-Dobs appeared in person prior to the case being called on the record. Mr Sadowski is housed at Dodge and not scheduled to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Caleb Anthony Sadowski not in court, defendant in custody. Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Caleb Anthony Sadowski in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Caleb Anthony Sadowski in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Caleb Anthony Sadowski appeared by video means with Attorney.   Case retabbed due to lower number case(s) pending. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
